lexUnit.name: avert.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: prevent or ward off (an undesirable occurrence).

sentence.text: As I heard no explosion , I presumed the danger had been averted .
The Letter of 1019--20 says that he intended to avert a threat to England , and succeeded in dealing with great dangers , so that the Danes would henceforth at need be able to assist the English .
A total catastrophe had been averted .
New US legislation , attempting to avert another such environmental catastrophe , has introduced a requirement for tankers operating in US waters to be double-skinned in future .
We are the last generation who can avert this catastrophe .
A global concerted effort is required to avert a global health crisis .
` Mining uranium out of the ground to fuel nuclear plants averts health effects of radon in later generations . "
Bush emphasized that he still hoped to avert war , and that a meeting could still go ahead in Baghdad between US Secretary of State James Baker and President Saddam Hussein a few days after Jan. 3 .
Only Batman Can Avert This Threat !
` Simply because he managed to avert such a disaster he was there for everyone to have a go at .
WHAT could have been a disastrous start for fifth-year pupils at Bohunt School to the social event of the school year was averted by quick-thinking and the help of a parent .

A compromise solution , it was secured largely thanks to unashamed procedural bullying by Mikhail Gorbachev , who warned that only unequivocal , draconian measures could avert a slide into economic chaos .
Conflict was averted by an emergency meeting between the Collective State Presidency and the Croatian leadership on Jan. 25 .
They had three sent off , the assistant manager Terry McDermott was apparently cautioned , there was a bomb scare and a pitch invasion was averted by police .
Some hours later one returned and claimed , modestly , that one 's own efforts alone had won the day , and the crisis had been averted .
A major fire was only averted by the quick action of Vigilant 's Chief Engineer , Alan Gregory .
Talks aimed at averting a trade war between the European Community and the United States of America are to resume next week .
THE Government last night moved to avert a threatened mass exodus of dentists from the NHS and put on ice plans to cut fees paid to them for dental work .
A second jet disaster was narrowly averted in Bogota on Thursday .
